headline: Ask HN: Personal Activity Tracker
description:
I've come to realize that I should be tracking the time I spend on work and non-work activities with the goals of a) being able to analyze how I spend my time and b) drive improvements in my life-management. I've looked around the Internet and there are tons of tools in this space, so I wanted to ask the community here what they're using. My list of requirements:

- Able to track the time I spend on an activity manually, this includes the date the activity occurred.

- Activities need to be categorized (meeting, 1:1, speaking at a webinar), either using tags or some field.

- Activities need to have a context (what project or effort is the activity for),

- I need to be able to analyze the data by activity type, activity context, time spent. At a minimum a CSV export would work. If it can generate graphs that's a bonus.

- I own the data. Due to security requirements the app either needs to be stand-alone running on my system (Windows) or something I can self-host.

- I'm not looking for project management software, I already have that supplied at work.
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 个人活动追踪器
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: 個人活動追蹤器
description_zh-Hans:
我已经意识到，我应该追踪我花在工作和非工作活动上的时间，目的是：a）能够分析我是如何花费时间的；b）推动我在生活管理方面的改进。我在网上看了看，这个领域有很多工具，所以我想问问这里的社区，他们在用什么。我的需求清单：

- 能够手动跟踪我花在活动上的时间，这包括活动发生的日期。

- 活动需要被分类（会议，1:1，在网络研讨会上发言），可以使用标签或一些字段。

- 活动需要有一个背景（什么项目或工作的活动），

- 我需要能够通过活动类型、活动背景、花费的时间分析数据。至少CSV导出就可以了。如果它能生成图表，那就更好了。

- 我拥有这些数据。由于安全要求，该应用程序需要在我的系统（Windows）上独立运行，或者我可以自行托管。

- 我不是在寻找项目管理软件，我在工作中已经有了这种软件。
